abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Rural Investment and Services Project for Moldova is to
            provide long-term support to accelerate agricultural
            recovery and growth so that Moldova's agricultural and
            rural sectors can play their full role in providing the
            underpinnings for future income growth and poverty
            reduction. The closing date for the project will be extended
            from June 30, 2012 until June 30, 2013. While the original
            project was approved in 2006 in the amount of US$16.00
            million, The 2008 additional financing was made available
            following a disastrous 2007 drought that resulted in a
            nearly 80 percent loss of the country's crops. The
            resources were provided for targeted investments for the
            rehabilitation of small-scale on-farm irrigation systems,
            and for dissemination of knowledge to farmers on techniques
            for adaptation to drought. The 2009 additional financing was
            made available to assist the Government of Moldova in
            staving off the impact of the global economic downturn on
            the country's rural economy by securing additional
            long-term credit resources in order to avoid a contraction
            of commercial lending to rural businesses, at a time when
            the original project's credit line was nearly fully
            disbursed. The project continues to make satisfactory
            progress towards the achievement of the Project Development
            Objective (PDO). Approximately 85 percent of the overall
            project resources were disbursed as of March 31, 2012. In
            light of this, the project was restructured in October, 2011
            to expand the eligibility of subprojects eligible for
            financing under this source from on-farm irrigation
            equipment only, to financing a wider array of
            faster-disbursing, rural-based investments eligible under
            the rural finance component. The extension is necessary to
            allow for additional time for the absorption of resources
            from the International Development Association (IDA), under
            the project's rural finance component, in order to
            provide additional credit resources to potential
            beneficiaries in an amount nearing US$4.5 million. The
            extension will allow the restructuring undertaken in
            October, 2011 to have a more meaningful effect by covering a
            full agricultural season. This will be the second extension
            of the project. The first extension of the closing date from
            June 30, 2010 to June 30, 2012 was required when the IDA was
            made available as an additional financing in 2009.
